Description: Jar of marl clay pottery with body tapering to a small flat base, high shoulder, inset neck and everted roll rim(chipped); decorated over the rim and shoulder with solid red paint, carelessly applied; five broad irregular wavy lines running vertically down the body to the base.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxxv.22)
